stories.title: What leads humans to divide the social world into groups, preferring their own?

stories.text:
Trying to get ideas for technical side projects to help me improve my depth of understanding on certain parts of the stack. Current rough ideas: * Write a react runtime * Write a js compiler * Write a node.js runtime

Curious if anyone else has any other ideas, or if there are any senior engineers out there that have done projects that really helped them in their career. (In either expected or unexpected ways.)
stories.title: Ask HN: Technical side project ideas for full stack engineers?
What’s the difference between the COM and EXE extensions?
Former Nintendo headquarters reopens as hotel in Kyoto
With $3B, biotech veterans launch a disease ‘reversal’ company

stories.text:
I feel immense regret for a lot of things that I didn't do in my 20s. Always an academic person, I intentionally sacrificed many things to make progress in academia, and yet, it didn't always work.

Didn't go to parties; didn't date seriously; didn't enjoy most of my time; and didn't follow all my interests.

I've been a long time HN reader and I believe in the wisdom of the HN community. As someone who's still in academia (grad school), what do you think I should do? I feel like I owe myself a lot, and even though I'm in a relationship now, I can't stop thinking about the opportunities that I missed with girls when I was younger. I also think about dropping out of the PhD program and transitioning to the industry, maybe because I feel like I'll never be appreciated in academia and maybe because I feel like I need a new beginning.
stories.title: Ask HN: About to turn 30. Any advice on how to deal with the depression?
